Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cobbler \Cob"bler\, n. 1. A mender of shoes. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
2. A clumsy workman. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
3. A beverage. See {Sherry cobbler}, under {Sherry}. [1913 Webster]
{Cobbler fish} (Zo["o]l.), a marine fish ({Blepharis crinitus}) of the Atlantic. The name alludes to its threadlike fin rays. [1913 Webster]

cobbler n 1: a person who makes or repairs shoes [syn: {shoemaker}] 2: tall sweetened iced drink of wine or liquor with fruit 3: made of fruit with rich biscuit dough usually only on top of the fruit [syn: {deep-dish pie}]
